text: How well do you understand design principles as the 'constitution' of a design system that guides all decision-making?
How experienced are you with creating comprehensive color systems that include primary, secondary, and functional colors with semantic meaning?
How comfortable are you with establishing typographic systems including type scales with specific font sizes, weights, and line heights?
How well do you understand iconography systems and maintaining visual consistency (filled vs outline, stroke weight, standard grid)?
How familiar are you with standardized spacing scales (4dp or 8dp grids) for margins, padding, and element distances?
How well do you understand the strategic imperative of design systems - the virtuous cycle of efficiency, consistency, scalability, and collaboration?
How comfortable are you with WCAG accessibility guidelines, ensuring minimum color contrast ratios (4.5:1 for normal text)?
How well do you understand that color should never be the sole means of conveying information - it needs icons, text labels, or shapes?
How experienced are you with motion design principles that provide feedback, guide user focus, and create meaningful experiences?
How well do you understand content guidelines including voice, tone, UX writing best practices, and capitalization rules?
How familiar are you with the concept of a design system as a 'living product' versus a static style guide?
How well do you understand how design foundations create a 'single source of truth' for all design decisions?
How comfortable are you with defining a unified design language that guides the design of a suite of products?
How experienced are you with ensuring color contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards (4.5:1 for normal, 3:1 for large text)?
How well do you understand the interconnection between foundations - how changing a color affects typography, components, etc.?
How familiar are you with Dynamic Type and ensuring UI reflows gracefully for user-defined text sizes?
How comfortable are you with creating icon libraries that maintain consistent style and visual weight?
How well do you understand layout grids as foundation elements that define how content is structured on pages?
How experienced are you with defining systematic interaction states (hover, focus, active, disabled, pressed) in foundations?
How well do you understand how design tokens bridge abstract foundations to concrete implementation?
How comfortable are you with theming systems that use color tokens to enable features like light and dark modes?
How familiar are you with ARIA attributes and semantic HTML for screen reader accessibility in foundations?
How well do you understand keyboard navigation requirements - ensuring all interactive elements are keyboard accessible?
How experienced are you with ensuring touch target sizes meet minimum requirements (44Ã—44px) for mobile accessibility?
How well do you understand that documentation is essential for foundations to explain the 'why', 'when', and 'how'?
How well do you understand what design tokens are - named entities that store visual design attributes as data?
How experienced are you with naming conventions for design tokens (e.g., $color-brand-primary-blue vs hardcoded #0052cc)?
How comfortable are you with token architecture - primitive tokens vs semantic tokens vs component tokens?
How well do you understand platform translation of tokens (CSS variables for web, XML for Android, Swift for iOS)?
How familiar are you with token formats (JSON, YAML) and how they're converted to platform-specific code?
How well do you understand how tokens bridge design and development, maintaining a single source of truth?
How experienced are you with color tokens specifically - creating semantic color token systems?
How comfortable are you with spacing tokens (margin, padding, gap) that ensure consistent spacing throughout?
How well do you understand typography tokens (font size, line height, font weight) as part of token systems?
How familiar are you with shadow and elevation tokens that create visual hierarchy?
How well do you understand token aliasing and referencing - how tokens can reference other tokens?
How experienced are you with managing token versions and updates across products?
How comfortable are you with token inheritance and composition - building token hierarchies?
How well do you understand how tokens enable theming (light/dark modes) through token variants?
How familiar are you with border radius tokens and shape tokens in design systems?
How well do you understand animation and transition tokens (duration, easing, delay)?
How experienced are you with token tools like Style Dictionary or Theo for managing tokens?
How comfortable are you with exporting tokens from design tools (Figma plugins) to code?
How well do you understand token naming strategies and conventions (BEM-style, namespacing)?
How familiar are you with semantic vs primitive tokens - when to use each approach?
How well do you understand token scale and hierarchy - creating systematic token scales?
How experienced are you with token documentation and specifications for teams?
How comfortable are you with token testing and validation to ensure quality?
How well do you understand token maintenance and evolution as systems grow?
How familiar are you with token APIs and programmatic access for consuming applications?
How well do you understand layout grid systems that define how content is structured on pages?
How experienced are you with type scale systems that manage typographic hierarchy consistently?
How comfortable are you with theming systems that use color tokens to enable light and dark modes?
How well do you understand breakpoint systems for responsive design across devices?
How familiar are you with elevation systems that use subtle value shifts to create visual hierarchy?
How well do you understand how core systems codify how design decisions work together (vs single tokens)?
How experienced are you with sizing systems that provide consistent dimensions for components?
How comfortable are you with responsive typography systems that adapt to screen sizes?
How well do you understand z-index systems that manage layering and stacking context?
How familiar are you with animation systems that define timing, easing, and motion principles?
How well do you understand how core systems provide solutions for common, recurring interface challenges?
How experienced are you with overlay systems that create depth and layering in UIs?
How comfortable are you with container systems that define content width and constraints?
How well do you understand responsive grid systems that adapt from mobile to desktop?
How familiar are you with aspect ratio systems for consistent media display?
How well do you understand how core systems build upon tokens to provide higher-level solutions?
How experienced are you with shadow systems that create depth and elevation hierarchy?
How comfortable are you with border systems that define consistent border styles and widths?
How well do you understand opacity systems for creating layered visual effects?
How familiar are you with backdrop filter systems for blur and overlay effects?
How well do you understand how core systems ensure consistency across complex layouts?
How experienced are you with fluid typography systems that scale smoothly between breakpoints?
How comfortable are you with container query systems for component-level responsive design?
How well do you understand how core systems document tried-and-true approaches to UI problems?
How familiar are you with multi-column layout systems for complex content structures?
How experienced are you with building reusable UI components that encapsulate design and behavior?
How comfortable are you with component composition - building complex components from simpler ones?
How well do you understand component variants (size, style, state) and when to create them?
How familiar are you with component APIs and props design for flexibility and reusability?
How experienced are you with component documentation including usage guidelines and code examples?
How well do you understand that components should be composites of tokens and core systems?
How comfortable are you with building component libraries (e.g., React, Vue, Angular) from design specs?
How well do you understand component categorization - Actions, Containment, Communication, Navigation, Selection?
How familiar are you with component accessibility - ensuring keyboard navigation, ARIA attributes, focus management?
How experienced are you with component testing - unit tests, visual regression, accessibility testing?
How well do you understand component state management - controlled vs uncontrolled components?
How comfortable are you with component theming - ensuring components work with theme systems?
How well do you understand component composition patterns - slots, children, render props?
How familiar are you with component versioning and breaking changes management?
How experienced are you with component design systems like Material UI, Ant Design, or Chakra UI?
How well do you understand component lifecycle - when to create, update, or deprecate components?
How comfortable are you with component performance optimization - lazy loading, code splitting?
How well do you understand component error boundaries and error handling patterns?
How familiar are you with component design kits in Figma - syncing design and code components?
How experienced are you with component APIs that balance flexibility with constraints?
How well do you understand component dependencies and avoiding circular dependencies?
How comfortable are you with component migration strategies when systems evolve?
How well do you understand component contribution workflows - submitting new components to systems?
How familiar are you with component analytics - tracking usage and adoption?
How experienced are you with component maintenance - keeping components updated and relevant?
How well do you understand design patterns vs components - patterns are 'how to' combine components to solve user goals?
How experienced are you with form patterns - combining inputs, labels, validation, and buttons effectively?
How comfortable are you with navigation patterns - breadcrumbs, pagination, tabs, steppers?
How well do you understand loading state patterns - spinners, skeletons, progress indicators?
How familiar are you with error handling patterns - inline errors, toast notifications, error pages?
How well do you understand empty state patterns - providing helpful context and clear CTAs?
How experienced are you with data display patterns - tables, lists, cards, grids?
How comfortable are you with search patterns - type-ahead, filters, results display, 'no results' handling?
How well do you understand notification patterns - when to use modals vs snackbars vs banners?
How familiar are you with onboarding patterns - progressive disclosure, tutorials, guided flows?
How well do you understand that patterns provide tested recipes for common user objectives?
How experienced are you with authentication patterns - login flows, registration, password reset?
How comfortable are you with filtering and sorting patterns for data-heavy interfaces?
How well do you understand user feedback patterns - confirmations, undo actions, status updates?
How familiar are you with wizard patterns - multi-step processes, progress indication, validation?
How well do you understand pattern documentation - usage guidelines, examples, anti-patterns?
How experienced are you with responsive patterns - how patterns adapt across screen sizes?
How comfortable are you with accessibility patterns - ensuring patterns work for all users?
How well do you understand that patterns shift burden from product teams to design system teams?
How familiar are you with dashboard patterns - layout, widgets, data visualization?
How experienced are you with modal patterns - dialogs, drawers, overlays for different contexts?
How well do you understand pattern variations - when and how to adapt patterns for specific needs?
How comfortable are you with pattern testing - validating patterns work well for users?
How well do you understand pattern evolution - how patterns improve based on usage and feedback?
How familiar are you with pattern libraries and how they complement component libraries?
How well do you understand design system governance models - centralized vs federated vs hybrid?
How experienced are you with contribution workflows - proposal, design, build, review, publish?
How comfortable are you with versioning strategies (Semantic Versioning) for design systems?
How well do you understand team models - centralized core team vs federated contributors?
How familiar are you with design system maintenance - ongoing updates, bug fixes, improvements?
How well do you understand that governance makes a design system a living product, not a project?
How experienced are you with decision-making processes - who decides what goes into the system?
How comfortable are you with communication strategies - changelogs, announcements, office hours?
How well do you understand contribution guidelines - standards for code, design, and documentation quality?
How familiar are you with review processes - design review, code review, accessibility review?
How well do you understand roadmap planning for design systems - prioritizing work, managing backlogs?
How experienced are you with adoption strategies - getting teams to use the design system?
How comfortable are you with metrics and KPIs for design systems - usage, adoption, impact?
How well do you understand the federated model - empowering contributors while maintaining quality?
How familiar are you with breaking change management - deprecation policies, migration guides?
How well do you understand that robust processes make systems trustworthy and sustainable?
How experienced are you with stakeholder management - getting buy-in, managing expectations?
How comfortable are you with community building around design systems - fostering collaboration?
How well do you understand design system maturity models - from initial to federated?
How familiar are you with design system documentation processes - keeping docs up to date?
How experienced are you with quality gates - ensuring contributions meet standards before merge?
How comfortable are you with design system retrospectives and continuous improvement?
How well do you understand design system product ownership - treating it as a product, not a project?
How familiar are you with design system evangelism - promoting adoption across the organization?
How experienced are you with design system strategy - long-term vision and evolution planning?
